title: Multilingual Neural Machine Translation System for Indic to Indic Languages. (arXiv:2306.12693v1 [cs.CL])
abstract: This paper gives an Indic-to-Indic (IL-IL) MNMT baseline model for 11 ILs implemented on the Samanantar corpus and analyzed on the Flores-200 corpus. All the models are evaluated using the BLEU score. In addition, the languages are classified under three groups namely East Indo- Aryan (EI), Dravidian (DR), and West Indo-Aryan (WI). The effect of language relatedness on MNMT model efficiency is studied. Owing to the presence of large corpora from English (EN) to ILs, MNMT IL-IL models using EN as a pivot are also built and examined. To achieve this, English- Indic (EN-IL) models are also developed, with and without the usage of related languages. Results reveal that using related languages is beneficial for the WI group only, while it is detrimental for the EI group and shows an inconclusive effect on the DR group, but it is useful for EN-IL models. tldr: 本文提出了11种印度语之间的神经机器翻译（MNMT）模型，并分析了这些模型的效率。结果表明，在一些情况下，使用相关语言是有益的，并且还建立了使用英语作为基准的MNMT模型。
en_tdlr: This paper proposes MNMT models for 11 Indic languages and analyzes their efficiency. The use of related languages is found to be beneficial in some cases and MNMT models using English as a pivot are also developed.
